entry.title: Re: Delta (statistical) depreciation areas missing in SAP...
entry.content:
Hi @maekman 

You are correct that, statistical depreciation areas are not delivered consistently across all localisations. This explains why in Finland you see areas 92/93 for Annual and Local Tax and Book Difference but in Sweden these are missing.

First it is important to understand why the issue you are facing happens

  • In Public Cloud, parallel accounting is handled via ledgers and depreciation areas.
  • In some localisations, SAP delivers statistical depreciation areas to capture the delta between book and tax depreciation posted statistically, not affecting APC.
  • In other countries, only the local tax area and book depreciation area exist, without a pre-delivered difference area.
  • SAP‚Äôs intention is that the difference is analysed via reporting and if required legally, adjusted with manual postings, unless the localisation mandates automated statistical posting.

 

These are the available options to enable you handle Local Tax vs Book Difference in Sweden

The first thing is to define a Statistical Depreciation Area Manually

  • In Manage Your Solution ‚Üí Configure Your Solution (SSCUI), check if you can add a new depreciation area with type ‚ÄúStatistical‚Äù.
  • If available, mirror the logic of Finland (92/93).
  • Assign a chart of depreciation that includes this statistical area.
  • Map it to a statistical G/L account (you will need to create one, as SAP has not delivered it).

Then you should make use of Ledger Group Postings Only

  • In Sweden, if the statutory requirement is not for automated statistical postings, you can post depreciation differences only in the relevant ledgers (0L/2L).
  • At year-end, run the depreciation calculation separately for local tax vs book depreciation.
  • Post the delta as a manual adjustment journal entry in General Ledger.

Finally, you need to custom your reporting without Statistical Area

  • Even without statistical areas, you can compare Depreciation Area 15 which is the Local Tax and Area 32 representing the Book using standard AA reports or CDS views. The delta can then be identified for reconciliation and adjustment postings.

 

SAP explicitly recommends adhering to the following guidelines:

  • Make use of parallel ledgers for IFRS vs Local GAAP.
  • Use depreciation areas for book vs tax values.
  • If no statistical area is delivered in a country, it is by design and that is because local regulations may not require SAP to generate delta postings automatically.
  • You may still create a customer-specific depreciation area if configuration is open in CBC for your country or handle the posting manually.

Parallel Accounting in Asset Accounting

Depreciation Areas

SAP Note 3286100

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Report for time recorded on projects
entry.content:
Yes ‚Äî SAP S/4HANA offers pre-delivered apps and reports that can help you track time spent on customer and internal projects, including monthly breakdowns and approval status. Here's how you can approach this:

1. Manage My Timesheet (Fiori App F3074A)
Allows employees to record time against customer/internal projects. Shows weekly and monthly views of time entries. Displays approval status if workflow is enabled. Supports both project-based and non-project time (e.g., admin, training). Ideal for individual time tracking and corrections.

2. Review Time Recordings
Used by project managers to monitor time booked by team members. Shows approved vs. pending time entries. Can be filtered by project, employee, and month.

3. Project Actuals Report (Project System / PPM)
Provides aggregated actual hours and costs posted to each project. Can be filtered by month, project type, and work package. Integrates with Controlling (CO) and Professional Services modules. This is your go-to for monthly summaries across multiple projects.

4. Team Utilization Overview
Shows how much time each team member has spent on projects. Highlights underutilization or overbooking. Can be filtered by project, month, and approval status.

Tips for getting the most out of these reports are

  • Make sure scope item 1YF ‚Äì Time Recording for Projects is activated
  • Use Workforce Planning to assign employees to projects
  • Enable workflow for time approval so approval status is visible in reports
  • Use Analytics Cloud (SAC) integration for advanced dashboards if needed

entry.title: Re: find the average of a calculated dimension
entry.content:
Hi Tracy,

your use of container in the formula has created a dependency on Container being in the table to return the correct values.

A potential solution for you.

Create an average calculation in the footer of the table below you have that contains Container & Time Between

Right click the average calculation in the footer and Assign References

Hide the table that contains Container & Time Between

Use the assigned reference to create the required table

Hope this helps

 

James

The business case is that we ship from the business to multiple customers, combining IM and WM materials on one truck/freight order. Thanks in advance for your insights.

entry.title: Building RAP model with 2 tables (header and items) and having Fiori preview with Single LUW
entry.content:
I have database model having 2 Z-tables where object has header record and its items. I would like have Fiori preview app to manage both these tables so that their item lines can be added within same LUW.  

The tables and CDS views I have managed to define so, that they have dependency to each other using joins and composite and parent-child relations.

So far I have managed to generate RAP model out of my Z-tables. But it results to SAP Fiori preview, where maintenance happens on one line containing item records having repeated header data. Understand I could use annotations to get items shown on separate screen, but I understand I could not get this to work on single LUW, meaning I first create Header record (draft) and then could add items (drafts) and then save everything on same LUW, so not that header should be saved separately first before can add items to it.

I have seen blogs and videos of RAP model having annotations on other related tables with Fiori app preview for display only. But not blog with CRUD features. Or well, found one by spyvee domain but I think it was incomplete guide and I never got it working. When googling "sap btp rap two tables", Google AI lists needed actions, but I consider its guidance is also not complete. I have heard being demonstrated by SAP (not yet seen myself), that ABAP AI could do what I am looking for.

So with this question I am asking if there is (which I haven't found yet) a blog for multiple table maintenance on RAP  or someone could provide complete guidance here.

I understand there is a RAP concept (with blogs) if tables are a customizing tables (consider similar as SM30 in old SAP ERP), but in my case tables are not customizing data.

entry.title: Instantly improve document information extraction
entry.content:
Introduction

If you are new to SAP Document AI service, it is a product offering by SAP to provide information extraction from business documents. This primarily helps your business save time by automating and streamlining processes that require information extraction from documents, such as invoices, payment advices, purchase orders, and bills of lading. It limits manual steps, therefore saving time, energy, manpower, and money, which you can invest in growing your business's critical functions.

Instant Learning and Models

As of this writing, and provided you are using Instant Learning, the Document AI uses a multi-model approach to deliver the best possible extraction results.  It has mainly three model categories: Pre-trained, LLM, and Rules (Template). Each category may have further different models.

Based on our experiments, it was evident that no single model is capable of achieving higher accuracies than combining them for extraction. This is backed by our evaluation pipeline, which constantly monitors the accuracy of the individual and the combination approach.

We took the facts from the above experiments and designed Document AI naturally using multi-models and optimized extraction based on user inputs on the corrections. This is the foundation of Instant Learning.

How to instantly learn

Start with Schema

A schema is the blueprint of your extraction. End-user defines fields and type of schema. Schema comes in mainly two flavours: Manual and Auto. Manual schemas are limited to template-based extraction, whereas the Auto schemas are more dynamic, powerful, and give the full potential of extraction.

Unless you want to use only the Template model (Rule-based extraction), you should create the Auto schemas, as they can also provide automatic templates depending on when the system thinks that a template could be a good fit for certain layouts.

Now, Auto schemas come in two further flavours depending on the configuration:

Auto with Default-extractor:

This combination works under the hood with all available model types. Pre-trained, LLM and Template.

Auto without Default-extractor:

This combination can automatically provide both LLM and Template extraction without requiring users to specify it.

Recommendation: For the SAP standard schemas, such as Invoice, PO, PA, etc., a user should use "Auto with Default-extractor". For everything else, a user must use the "Auto without Default-extractor".

Extraction, Feedback, and Repeat

Once you have set up your schema and activated it, you are ready for extraction. As you are aware, the following is only applicable to the Auto schema with any flavor.

Your first extraction may not be something you like. It may have errors or inaccuracies. To remove such inaccurate extraction, you need to input it into the system, or in other words, provide feedback to the system.

You can add your feedback in many forms. Let me cover them here:

Feedback as a Schema Description

You are the controller of your extraction. If you want to influence the overall extraction and help the system know your schema better, you can explain that in the description field of the Schema. Your description should resemble a prompt for an LLM.

Feedback as a Schema Field Description

If you see the extraction is inaccurate for a field, then you can add a general instruction for the field, explaining the field, also sharing an example if that is common in all documents for the schema.

Feedback as a Confirm Document

Confirm documents are used to improve models, but without a guarantee. I recommend that you try and test extraction optimization based on your confirmed document-based feedback. Now, confirm that the documents can be used to influence pre-trained model extraction and LLM extraction, depending on your contractual agreement for using Document AI, and allow SAP to use such documents for the extraction.

To confirm a document, the user should carefully review the extraction, correct any incorrect field values, and confirm the document by either making the API call or using the "Confirm" button on the UI.

The Confirm Document not only affects the model but also helps the system select the best model for extraction by switching between models. I will not touch upon the model switching in the blog post, but rather describe how an individual model can be affected with the "Confirm Document".

Pre-trained model

Confirming documents to improve the pre-trained model is a longer cycle and cannot be tested immediately. This requires the engineering teams to scrutinise the data, evaluate training results, and release new models with upcoming releases. This takes time, often weeks.

LLM extraction

Confirm documents can also be used for LLM extraction improvement, which is fundamental to Instant Learning, provided that you opt in for the feature. This optimization is instantly done when a user confirms a document. However, you may still encounter issues with the extraction in rare cases. If the user continues confirming one more document here, the model switching will use the Template model (the rule-based model) to try the extraction further.

Template

Confirm documents are used as samples for automatically created templates. System automatically finds out if you need one more template to optimize your extraction and create it.

After this, the extraction would be at its best possible accuracy. I have omitted the system-level steps for brevity. To learn more about how to do all of these, please visit the Document AI documentation on the official help portal.

Disclaimer: The information in the blog post is my personal opinion and is based on my understanding of the topic. Before making a purchase or using the system in production, please review SAP's official guidance on the product. Please visit the official published help documentation for the product for more information.

entry.title: Re: What's New in SAP Analytics Cloud Modeling Extensions & Integration QRC3 2025 Release
entry.content:
Hi Miguel,

As mentioned in the article, input enablement for the WAVG formula is restricted to leaf nodes currently.

Here is an example of WAVG usage.

In my model, I create a WAVG calculated measure using of [Sales Revenue] using [Quantity Sold] as the assigned weight, for a given [Product] and [Date].

In my story, I create a table using [Sales Revenue], [Quantity Sold] and the newly created WAVG calculation, using the [Product] and [Date] dimensions.

Input enablement is automatically available on the leaf nodes.  It is planned to make this available on upper members of the hierarchy in the future.

Best regards,

Amanda

entry.title: Re: Transcript Outlining the Record to Report Process in...
entry.content:
When I accessed SAP Learning Hub through the plateau.learning hub website, I found that you can easily retrieve the course materials. One way is to download the Learning Hub Catalogue - this shows all the items accessible in the Learning Hub.

Now, if the item you are looking for is listed as an e-learning course, it usually comes with a corresponding PDF file that you can save for offline use. Just click the link and it will direct you to the file where you can access and download the file.

For example, I'm checking out the Financial Academy for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, where the PDF version is available once I enter the link. You can then keep a copy for reference and review even outside the platform.

SAP Learning Solution SAP Learning Hub

entry.title: üì£ SAP Emarsys: Q3 2025 Product Release üì£
entry.content:
As customer expectations continue to evolve, marketers need the speed, intelligence, and flexibility to meet them where they are engaging, in real time. With our Q3 2025 product release, SAP Emarsys is helping you accelerate growth, elevate personalization, and drive measurable engagement across every channel. 

Q3 release brings AI-powered tools, deeper integrations, and additional platform capabilities - all designed to deliver business outcomes faster and more efficiently. 

Let‚Äôs dive in. 

This release brings AI-powered tools, deeper integrations, and flexible platform capabilities - all designed to deliver business outcomes faster and more efficiently.

Let‚Äôs dive in.

Deliver Omnichannel Excellence at Scale 

Digital Ads: Microsoft Ads (GA) 

SAP Emarsys‚Äô Microsoft Ads integration is now available to all customers. Leverage contact and behavioral data to build precise target audiences and extend your reach across the Microsoft Search Network, including Bing and Yahoo. 

Bounce Mail Management Enhancements (GA) 

Our modernized Bounce Management capability delivers improved scalability and UI performance. Reactivate soft-bounced contacts, individually or in bulk, to regain active reach while protecting sender reputation. 

New Segment Editor (GA) 

The improved Segment Editor simplifies complex segmentation with a modern UI and AI-generated human-readable segment descriptions, helping you work faster with greater transparency and less manual effort. 

Mobile Wallet in Interactions (Pilot) 

Mobile Wallet passes can now be triggered and updated in real-time through Interactions based on customer behaviors and events, such as a notifying a customer of their upgraded loyalty tier.  

‚ÄúWith Mobile Wallet, I can send notifications to many customers; it‚Äôs essentially a new channel we can use. It‚Äôs very beneficial, especially for our loyalty program.‚Äù 
‚Äî Melanie Kordel, CRM Team Lead, CHRIST 

Read more here 

Conversational Channel: LINE (Pilot) 

We‚Äôve introduced LINE as our second Conversational Channel (via Sinch), expanding reach, especially across the Asia-Pacific region. Send personalized text and card messages, automate journeys, and gain full visibility with campaign-level analytics. 

If you're interested in joining this pilot or any early adopter program, reach out to your Customer Success Manager. 

AI-Driven Intelligence for Smarter Marketing 

AI-assisted Product Finder (GA) 

Now generally available, AI-assisted Product Finder enables marketers to embed relevant products into email campaigns seamlessly with natural language search to quickly locate the desired items. For example, search for ‚Äútop selling women's shoes under $100‚Äù and get results immediately to build an upcoming sale campaign, without code or IT involvement.  Enhancements include: 

  • Real-time product updates 
  • Localization and multi-language support of product details 
  • SAP Emarsys Scripting Language (ESL) compatibility 
  • Support for dynamic pricing and catalog variations 

AI-assisted Campaign Translator (Pilot) 

Use AI to translate campaigns directly inside the content editor. The tool works with SAP‚ÄôsAI translation service, DeepL, or Smartling to deliver personalized, multi-language content - preserving dynamic elements and saving time. 

AI-assisted Segment Description Generator (GA) 

Integrated exclusively into the New Segment Editor, this feature translates complex segment logic into clear, human-readable summaries, giving marketers clarity and confidence about who they are targeting, while reducing time to execution. 

Extensible & Composable for Every Strategy 

Account Engagement: Extensibility for Segmentation (GA) 

B2B marketers can now integrate custom API data into the Account Factsheet and for Account-Based Segmentation. Include fields such as: 

  • Industry 
  • Revenue bands 
  • Employee size 
  • Region 
  • Technology stack 

Combine these attributes with behavioral data for precision targeting and sales-aligned marketing. 

Product Catalog API Enhancements (Pilot) 

We‚Äôve extended Product Catalog API support to include Predict and Smart Insight users. With faster, incremental updates, brands can ensure campaigns always reflect the latest catalog changes, especially during peak sales periods. 

Engagement Events: Interactions Entry Node (Pilot) 

Now featuring a dedicated entry node in Interactions, marketers can initiate journeys based on real-time customer events like: 

  • Loyalty status upgrades 
  • Subscription renewals 
  • Contract milestones 

This pilot enables faster activation, reduces reliance on development teams, and enhances transparency for event-driven campaigns.  

Built for Enterprise 

User Management via Identity Provider (GA) 

We‚Äôve streamlined login with automatic SSO detection. When SSO is configured, users are automatically routed to your identity provider login, while others continue to use traditional SAP Emarsys credentials. 

Thank you for exploring this product release with us. If you'd like to learn more about these features, how they work, and the value you can realize:  

  • Read the full product release blog  
  • Explore the full details on the product release page  
  • Register for the Q3 2025 Emarsys Release Webinar on September 4th  

Join Us at SAP Connect 

Customer Experience Connect returns‚Äînow as a dedicated experience within SAP Connect. Still focused on empowering CX leaders like you, this year‚Äôs Customer Experience Connect delivers the content, connections, and innovation you‚Äôve come to expect. New this year are expanded opportunities to engage across the broader SAP ecosystem. Join us to reignite the experience you love, in a bold new format. 

üëâ Register now

entry.title: Re: Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure - activitie...
entry.content:
Thank you for the response.

To clarify, the plant that had this issue (let's say plant #2) was not edited manually in IMG during deployment. This happened earlier in the day with a different plant (plant #1). After reactivating, all the information for plant #1 came through correctly. Later, we edited plant #2's name in CBC and deployed the changes, but it skipped the activity that updates the plant name in IMG. So there are no changes to revert in IMG.

We are also unable to edit the plant name field when editing the address data in IMG - we can only modify the plant name through CBC.

entry.title: Localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
Hello and welcome to this blog covering the release highlights for localization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508. In our mission to help you run your business everywhere, we are continuously expanding our global footprint and enhancing our solutions to meet the specific legal and business requirements of countries around the world. This release is packed with significant advancements, including a brand-new local version for Vietnam, a peek into the future with AI for tax calculations, major strides in our self-service localization tools, and expanded integration with Taulia.

Localization

  • Vietnam Local Version
  • Beta Campaign AI understanding tax calculation
  • CLT GA and LaaSS
  • Taulia Integration
  • Help Documentation/ Release restriction Note

Let‚Äôs dive into the details!


Expanding Our Global Reach: Welcome, Vietnam!

We are very proud to announce the delivery of our latest local version for Vietnam. This addition empowers businesses to operate seamlessly within the Vietnamese market, ensuring full compliance with local financial regulations and business practices right out of the box.

Value Proposition: This new local version significantly reduces the complexity and risk of entering or operating in the Vietnamese market. By providing pre-configured content that adheres to local laws and standards, we enable you to accelerate your implementation, ensure compliance, and focus on your core business activities with confidence in your financial data and reporting.

Capabilities: The Vietnam local version is a comprehensive package designed to meet your core financial needs. It includes a country-specific chart of accounts mapped to the Vietnamese Accounting Standards (VAS) and pre-configured VAT and withholding tax procedures. To meet statutory requirements, we deliver critical reporting capabilities, including the VAT report and declaration, and a specific withholding tax report (form 01/NTNN). You can also manage electronic invoicing for outbound scenarios and generate key financial statements like the trial balance, balance sheet, and profit and loss reports, all formatted according to VAS.


A Glimpse into the Future: AI-Powered Tax Calculation Insights

Imagine a world where complex tax calculations are no longer a black box. We are currently running a beta campaign for a groundbreaking feature that uses the power of SAP Business AI and our digital assistant, Joule, to provide instant clarity on tax determination. This is a significant step forward in making tax management more transparent and user-friendly.

Value Proposition: This innovation empowers finance users by providing on-demand, easy-to-understand explanations for tax calculations directly within their workflow. This transparency saves valuable time, reduces the risk of posting errors, and allows for proactive corrections, ultimately leading to more accurate financial data and improved operational efficiency.

Capabilities: With "Understanding tax calculations," users can ask Joule how the tax in a specific business document was calculated. Joule will provide a clear, contextual explanation of the tax determination, detailing the specific parameters and rules that influenced the outcome. This allows users to make informed decisions and any necessary corrections *before* an item is posted, moving from reactive problem-solving to proactive validation.

Register for Beta testing here: Understanding Tax Calculations with Joule - Customer Influence Page

Testing scope is limited to Sales Order Posting for India


Empowering You: Localization-as-a-Self-Service (LaaSS) and CLT General Availability

Flexibility and customer empowerment are at the heart of our strategy. With the 2508 release, we are thrilled to announce that the Configuration Localization Tool (CLT) is now generally available. This, combined with our ongoing Localization-as-a-Self-Service (LaaSS) innovations, gives you unprecedented control to extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud to countries beyond our standard delivered versions.

Value Proposition: CLT and our LaaSS innovations provide you with the speed and agility to support your global business rollouts. You are no longer limited to the 60 SAP-delivered local versions. This self-service approach allows you and your partners to create compliant localizations for over 160 additional countries, dramatically accelerating project timelines and tailoring the system to your unique global footprint.

Capabilities: The now generally available Configuration Localization Tool (CLT) enables you to create a new customer local version by using an SAP-delivered country version as a reference. The tool intelligently generates the necessary configuration, which you can then deploy to your system. We are further enhancing this with two new scope items (7VW and 7WP) that enable invoice-time withholding tax and bill of exchange processing for all CLT-created local versions. Additionally, we are pushing the boundaries of extensibility with a labs preview for using SAP Business AI to manage localized form templates and providing self-service configuration for electronic freight invoices in Brazil.


Strengthening Your Financial Supply Chain: Taulia Integration Expands to Canada

Optimizing working capital is a top priority for every CFO. Our seamless, embedded integration with Taulia helps you unlock liquidity trapped in your accounts receivable. With this release, we are excited to extend this powerful capability to our customers in Canada.

Value Proposition: The embedded Taulia Receivables Financing solution for Canada enables you to improve cash flow, reduce reliance on traditional debt, and strengthen your balance sheet. By converting receivables into cash within 24 hours, you can fund growth, manage seasonal fluctuations, and optimize financial metrics‚Äîall without ever leaving your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

Capabilities: Now available in Canada, this solution allows you to sell eligible receivables to a multi-funder network with just a few clicks. The process is seamless, from invoice creation in S/4HANA Cloud to AI-powered pricing and funding. The automated journal entries and payment records ensure touch-free reconciliation, freeing up your finance team for more strategic tasks. Furthermore, the financing is undisclosed, meaning your customer relationships are preserved while you gain the financial flexibility your business needs.

Help Documentation/ Release restriction Note

SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508, Local Versions, Release Restriction Note

Thank you for joining me for this overview of our 2508 localization highlights. We are committed to being your trusted partner on your journey to becoming an intelligent, sustainable enterprise.

 

Watch the replays of our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 Early Release Series!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

Between July 21 and July 25, we conducted a series of 21 engaging live sessions to showcase the thrilling innovations included in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release. If you missed the live sessions, don't worry! You can still access the whole series or select the sessions that interest you the most. Seize this opportunity to watch them on demand at your convenience‚Äìanywhere, anytime.‚ÄØ

entry.title: SAC Addin with Datasphere Models: Potential problems with table data?
entry.content:
Dear DSP&SAC Addin users,

I've got a - maybe - strange question... but a client of mine hestitates in applying this solution for a time dimension view, where about 20 analytic models are affected (due to association in the underlying fact views).

He claims that on previous changes/updates in the analytic models, several of their Excel reports, created with the SAC Addin (not AO SAC Edition) would be corrupt and could no longer be used.

I tried to find answers here in the community and in SAP for me, but it seems nobody else reported such an issue.

Of course, I can imagine, that if you remove a dimension (or associated attribute view) in the fact view & Analytic model that this is no longer available in the Excel table ... but does this really cause the failure of using it? Would not a "Refresh" of the data source display the remaining table data like before, just without this attribute?

Would also added dimensions or attributes (in fact or AM) have any negative effect on the SAC Addin table in Excel?

Unfortunately I took over support only recently, since the internal colleauge left the company. So, I have no proof for this, so far.

I'm looking forward to your experiences.

BR, Martin

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @ManonH 

You are correct that the delivered Time Sheet Submission Criteria options are limited, they focus on conditions such as has absences, has imported entries, has manual entries, etc. By default, an untouched empty timesheet does not generate an external code and therefore is skipped in the TimeSheetSubmit job.

Just to provide more details, here is why your empty Timesheets are skipped

  • If no entries exist, no time valuation result is created.
  • Submission rules tied only to criteria like Has manual entries or Has absences will never trigger.

Here is how you can explicitly cover empty Timesheets

There are two standard approaches you can use:

Option A is, to make use of the Full Work Schedule Covered Submission Criteria

  • Define a rule where the submission criterion is Full work schedule covered.
  • For employees who only record overtime, the base schedule is already derived from their planned working time.
  • This ensures that even if no overtime entries are recorded, the system considers the timesheet as covered and will auto-submit.

Option B, is to use a Blanket System Context Rule

  • Create a Time Sheet Submission Rule with no positive conditions (no absences/manual entries required).
  • Assign it at the Time Recording Submission Configuration level.
  • This forces the rule to catch all timesheets for the employee population, including those with no recorded entries.

Alternatively, you have the possibility to Schedule Control. If you want more control, you can also trigger submission via the Time Recording Calendar, which pushes auto-submission on the defined end date of each period. This ensures that even untouched timesheets (no entries at all) are submitted.

 

Below is a step by step procedure to help you achieve the desired solution.

First step is to go to Manage Data

  • Create a new Time Sheet Submission Rule.
  • Name it: Auto-Submit Empty Timesheets.
  • Scenario: Time Sheet Submission.

Second step is to define the desired Parameters

  • Context: System Context
  • Submission Criteria: Select Full Work Schedule Covered


This ensures that if an employee has a planned working time but no actual entries (untouched timesheet), the system still considers the week as covered and allows auto-submission.

Third step is to define the Action

  • In the Then section, select Submit Time Sheet.

Fourth step is to assign the Rule

  • Go to Manage Data ‚Üí Time Recording Submission Configuration.
  • Assign your new Auto-Submit Empty Timesheets rule to the Submission Rules section.
  • Make sure this configuration is linked to the Time Recording Profile of your overtime-only employees.

Fifth step is optional, you can add Time Recording Calendar

  • If you want to guarantee all timesheets (even when the work schedule is non-standard), assign a Time Recording Calendar so the system triggers auto-submission on period end.

 

Below are some references for more details.

Time Recording Submission Configuration

Time Recording Calendar

I hope this helps.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite
entry.content:
Process-Aware Agentic Testing of SAP with Int4 Suite

Let‚Äôs start with a simple example every SAP consultant knows:

Test Case: Create Standard Sales Order (VA01)

Step 1: Enter transaction code VA01 in the command box.
Expected Result: ‚ÄúCreate Sales Order‚Äù initial screen is displayed.

Step 2: On the initial screen, enter details like:

  • Order Type: <ip_Order_Type>
  • Sales Organization: <ip_Sales_Org>
  • Distribution Channel: <ip_distr_channel>
  • Division: <ip_division>

Step 3: Click Enter.

Step 4: Enter header details such as:

  • PO Number: <ip_PO_number>
  • Sold-to Party: <ip_sold_to_party>
  • Ship-to Party: <ip_ship_to_party>
  • PO Date: <ip_PO_date>

Step 5: Enter item details:

  • Material: <ip_Material>
  • Order Quantity: <ip_Order_qty>
  • Plant: <ip_plant>

Step 6: Click Save.
Expected Result: ‚ÄúStandard Order XXXXXX has been saved.‚Äù

Looks perfect on paper. But in real life, there are two big problems:

  1. Where to get the correct data to start the test? A VA01 script needs valid values for customer, material, plant, and so on. Guesswork doesn‚Äôt work. The best source is historical data already posted on production by one of the integrations. Int4 Suite can use millions of these API transactions as the foundation for realistic tests.

  1. What if the required master or stock data is missing in test? Even with a historical sales order in hand, posting might fail because the material never existed in the test system, the customer master is missing, or there‚Äôs no stock. This is where Int4 Suite acts agentically: it can copy the missing material from production, create stock via another API, and retry posting automatically.

This is the heart of Process-Aware Agentic Testing. Process-aware, because the software knows what data and conditions are needed for the test. Agentic, because it acts on its own to prepare that business context and complete the transaction.

And this problem is not limited to VA01. In many SAP projects, test automation still works in a very ‚Äúdry‚Äù way. A tool calls a transaction with some example data and checks the response. Technically it works, but it‚Äôs not how real business runs. It‚Äôs like testing a car engine without fuel in the tank, without air in the tires, and without a driver inside. The engine starts, but you can‚Äôt really drive anywhere.

Dry testing always brings the same frustrations:

  • Functinal consultants must provide ‚Äúreference data‚Äù,
  • missing objects must be prepared manually ‚Äì by functional consultants,
  • results are very hard to repeat.

Int4 Suite changes this. With access to millions of historical API transactions and the ability to prepare business objects through SAP S/4HANA APIs, it makes every test run in full business context.

  • Example 1: Posting a historical sales order fails because the material is missing. Int4 Suite copies the material from production, creates stock, and retries the posting.
  • Example 2: Testing a delivery fails because the sales order doesn‚Äôt exist in test. Int4 Suite can post a new sales order via API based on historical data, and then create the delivery.

For SAP S/4HANA projects, this is a new paradigm. Instead of brittle scripts and endless manual setup, you get agentic, process-aware testing: tests that adapt, prepare their own data, and validate full business processes end-to-end.

In short: don‚Äôt just test if a transaction runs. Test if it runs with the right business context. That‚Äôs the future of SAP testing with Int4 Suite.

entry.title: PGI and PGR in Advanced Returns Management (ARM)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm trying to better understand how PGI (Post Goods Issue) and PGR (Post Goods Receipt) entries work in Advanced Returns Management (ARM). Below is the scenario I‚Äôm testing:

Scenario 1: Standard OTC (MTO process)

  1. Sales Order ‚Äì Created for MTO.

  2. Delivery ‚Äì Inventory is posted against the sales order and line item, and PGI is executed.

  3. Billing ‚Äì Invoice (F2) is generated.

Scenario 2: Advanced Returns Management

  1. Advanced Return Order ‚Äì Created with reference to the invoice of the above MTO sales order.

  2. Delivery + PGR ‚Äì Return delivery is created, PGR is posted, and inventory is received into blocked stock (to be scrapped). no credit memo because we will create Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge

Scenario 3: Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (SD-FC)

  1. Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge Sales Order with requirement type KE (MTO) ‚Äì Created from the advanced return order. 

  2. Delivery ‚Äì Delivery is created for this order.

  3. PGI Issue ‚Äì When I attempt to do PGI, the system does not allow PGI if I upload the inventory against the SD-FC sales order and line item (it shows no inventory available).

    • However, if I upload the inventory against the return sales order and line item, then PGI is allowed for the SD-FC delivery.

       

Question

Is this the expected system behavior in ARM?

In classic returns, when we create a subsequent delivery free of charge sales order with reference to the return order, the system usually allows PGI if stock is uploaded directly against the SD-FC sales order and line item.

But in ARM, it seems PGI only works if the stock is uploaded against the return sales order instead of the SD-FC sales order.

üëâ Could someone clarify if this difference is by design in ARM or if I‚Äôm missing a configuration step?

entry.title: Re: How to know about Licenses from SAP Analytics Cloud tenant.
entry.content:
Hi @DavidNYC 

if you are using Live connection in SAC, yes the SAC user will be authenticating against the S/4 backend in real-time and should have an equivalent S/4 user so that they see the right slice of data. 

If however you are using an Import connection in SAC, then the SAC connection is ok with a generic S/4 technical user. But on top of this the acquired data models need to have Data Access Controls overlayed on them so that the SAC user only sees the right slice of data. 

regards, H

entry.title: Re: ASSIGN PURCHASING ORGANIZATION TO COMPANY CODE
entry.content:
Hello @jerrysam 

Thank you for your question. The customising step, Assign Purchasing Organisation to Company Code, establishes the link between purchasing activities and financial postings in SAP S/4HANA.

If you remove this assignment:

The purchasing organisation becomes a cross-company code, not associated with a single company code

You can still create purchasing documents, 

    • The system will no longer automatically generate the company code from the assignment.
    • Any purchasing transactions, PO, contracts, source list, etc., will require an explicit company code assignment at the document or plant level.
  • If you already have purchase orders, source lists, or contracts created under that assignment, removing it may cause inconsistencies or errors in follow-on processes such as account determination, invoice verification.

Recommendation:

  • Only remove the assignment if you are certain the purchasing organisation should operate cross-company.
  • First check if any existing documents are active under that assignment. If so, you may encounter errors when processing or reporting.
  • If this is only for testing/troubleshooting, like for the source list, it's better to reconfigure the source list settings instead of removing the organisational assignment.

Adding a Unit to Company Code-SAP Help 

Purchasing Organisations-SAP Help 

Let me know if you need further information

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: FINT and value date for outstanding receivables
entry.content:
Hello SAP-Friends,

is there any way that FINT is able to take the value date of the EBST-posting into account during calculation of the outstanding days of receivables. I know we can set up tolerance-days and transfer-days and calendars in the FINT-customizing, but it is not really the same thing. My business desires to have the calucation of interest days not between due date and clearing date, but between the due date and the value date (VALUT) of the posting of the EBST (electronic bank statement). 

Did you hear a requirement like this before?
Thanks for your suggestions, thoughts, opinions.

KR
Christina

ps: My business sees that the SEPA-realtimetransfers as a risk, that we get more differences between value date and clearing date.

entry.title: Re: Hidden field in VBAP table - Private Edition
entry.content:
This is certainly not at all a stupid question

In S/4HANA, especially in Private Edition, SAP has streamlined many screens and fields for usability and performance. Some fields; even standard ones are not included in the screen layout by default, especially if they‚Äôre rarely used or industry-specific. So even though EXART exists in the VBAP structure, it won‚Äôt appear unless it‚Äôs explicitly included in the screen layout of the sales order item.

To confirm this, follow the below steps

Step 1: Confirm the Field Is Not on the Screen
Go to VA01 or VA02, navigate to the item level, press F1 on any field ‚Üí then click Technical Info. If EXART isn‚Äôt there, it‚Äôs not part of the screen layout.

Step 2: Check the Screen Program and Layout
The screen for sales order item data is part of program SAPMV45A. The relevant screen numbers are typically 8459 or 8460 for item-level data. Use transaction SE80 to inspect the screen layout and see if EXART is included.

Step 3: Use Enhancement or Screen Exit
If EXART is not included, you can add it using a screen enhancement. Go to SE80 ‚Üí Program SAPMV45A, look for screen 8459 or 8460, use customer subscreen area to add EXART. Implement logic in includes MV45AOZZ (PBO) and MV45AIZZ (PAI) to handle the field. This is a clean way to add standard or custom fields to the VA01/VA02 screen without modifying SAP standard.

entry.title: Re: Consuming the Parameterized CDS View using OData in Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi Ashwin,

Yes, "I_assetbalancecube" doesn't support delta, so we have applied a dynamic date filter range on the asset capitalization date while fetching records from OData as per our requirement. Then we are doing a full load in Datasphere, as the volume of records is low.

If we perform a full load with high data volume, then it might affect performance, but since we are extracting only a subset of data based on our filter criteria, we haven't faced performance-related issues so far.

Thanks, 

 Ankit

entry.title: Re: THERE IS AN ERROR WHILE POSTING FB50
entry.content:
I figured it out, follow the steps as below:

step-1: click on the error

step-2: it will take you the the message box click on the FINS_CUST_CONS_CHK_P.

step-3: it will show you all the other ledgers that your company code has been assigned to.

step-4: go to FINSC_LEDGER tcode and click on each ledger other than 0L, and click on company code settings and delete and save it.

step-5: once this is done and you have repeated the process for all the ledgers showing error, now go back to FB50, and post again from the first.

entry.title: Re: Scripting Tracker - Development Tool for SAP GUI Scripting
entry.content:
Scripting Tracker is an amazing tool that has been of tremendous help for everybody involved in SAP automation. It will be missed, but nowadays there is a simple way to automate the SAP GUI, which does not require IDs. RoboSAPiens  is a Python library (with a C# core that wraps the SAP GUI Scripting API), which allows automating the SAP GUI using text selectors exclusively.

For those that still want (or need) to work with IDs, NwbcPropertyCollector.exe (installed with NetWeaver Business Client) provides an inspector that displays the object tree and the properties of the elements, just like Scripting Tracker. It works with both SAP GUI and NetWeaver.

Dear SAP Support Team,

We are currently implementing EDI integration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for the first time and seek guidance on the recommended approach. Specifically, we plan to integrate the following ANSI X12 transaction sets:

  • 830 ‚Äì Planning Schedule

  • 810 ‚Äì Invoice

  • 856 ‚Äì Advance Ship Notice

Given the restrictions and architecture of the Public Cloud edition, we would appreciate clarification on:

  1. Supported Integration Mechanisms

  2. Availability of Scope Items

  3. Mapping and Transformation Tools

  4. Partner Connectivity

  5. Monitoring and Error Handling

Kind Regards
Aditya Sharma

entry.title: Beyond Fiori: Elevating UX in SAP Systems to Drive Real Business Value
entry.content:
In the world of ERP, and particularly within SAP environments, UX is often discussed in terms of visual appeal and Fiori tiles. However, the true strategic value of UX goes far beyond aesthetics. It is about transforming the way users interact with complex systems, reducing friction, and unlocking measurable business impact. This post explores advanced aspects of UX in SAP, the challenges organizations face, and actionable strategies that drive real results.

UX is not just about making interfaces look good. It begins with a deep understanding of the end-to-end processes and the human context in which the system operates. Every process step carries potential for error, inefficiency, or delay. Designing for role-specific needs rather than for screens ensures that every user, from HR managers to warehouse operators, experiences an optimized workflow. Good UX directly improves KPIs by reducing errors, shortening task completion times, and increasing adoption rates across the organization.

Integrating UX with analytics creates a powerful feedback loop. Real usage data uncovers which screens waste time, where users encounter obstacles, and which processes are bypassed or executed inefficiently. Insights from these analytics allow organizations to redesign flows rather than simply polish screens, because ERP UX is fundamentally flow-driven, not pixel-driven.

Automation and intelligent design take UX to the next level. Simplifying forms, minimizing unnecessary fields, and providing context-aware recommendations reduces cognitive load and errors. Inline validations and immediate feedback improve accuracy and boost confidence in the system. These patterns turn SAP from a rigid tool into a proactive assistant for the user.

Drawing inspiration from B2B and B2C UX standards can further elevate ERP systems. Consistency across desktop, mobile, and tablet platforms ensures users experience the same intuitive interactions regardless of device. Micro-interactions and subtle feedback cues improve comprehension and engagement. Adaptive interfaces tailored to roles, departments, or geographic context make the system feel personalized without requiring extensive customization.

Finally, UX success in SAP is as much about culture as it is about design. Executive support is critical to challenge entrenched workflows and encourage adoption of improved practices. Collaboration between IT and business units ensures that UX improvements are meaningful and strategic rather than cosmetic. Investment in user training, combined with iterative design informed by real-world data, creates a sustainable UX-driven culture that delivers measurable business outcomes.

Elevating UX in SAP is not a one-time project; it is a continuous journey that blends design thinking, process insight, analytics, and cultural alignment. When executed thoughtfully, it transforms SAP from a functional system into a strategic enabler, enhancing efficiency, accuracy, and overall business performance.

entry.title: Unable to change the UoM
entry.content:
I have loaded some materials through LTMC. After uploading i wanted to change the base unit of measure through MM02. there are no transactions where this materials have been used, but the system is not allowing me to change the base unit of measure. the error it is showing is mentioned in the screenshot.

Eg - uploded unit through LTMC is "PC" but the unit i want to change it to is "EA".

 

When i uploaded through LTMC. i have used the field the base unit of measure (ISO Format) field. What could be the issue and how can i resolve it. please assist.

entry.title: Re: Using LPD_CUST to create launch page for FPM obsolete?
entry.content: LPD_CUST is only deprecated in the context of Fiori Launchpad. There is no restriction in using it for FPM and Web Dynpro applications! There are no plans to set this transaction to 'obsolete'

entry.title: IAS- Notification for Migrated users from External Sites - Learning only-user
entry.content: Hi I would like to ask: if email notifications are enabled in IAS, when the ReadJob is executed for the users migrated from Learning, will they receive a notification to activate their accounts?

entry.title: Re: New Resource-Related Intercompany Billing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition
entry.content:
Hi! Great blog, thanks for sharing this.
I‚Äôm trying to understand if there‚Äôs a way to identify which resource each line item belongs to at the billing level. Currently, when two resources post time, the intercompany billing request generates two separate line items. However, those line items don‚Äôt seem to contain any details that link them back to the individual resources. Are there any standard fields or recommended approaches to make this traceability clearer?

entry.title: Re: How to archive files in SAP CPI FTP/SFTP Sender
entry.content:
Hi Guys, I am picking a file Sample.txt from a Directory under root( /Main) and I archive it with timestamp and place it in another directory under root /Archive using Move option with the syntax ../Archive/{filename.with noext}{currrentdatetime}.{filename.ext} 

The issue is the file gets processed from Main folder and is moved with timestamp Sample20250820112233.txt, The execution should stop here. But the adapter processes this file from /Archive and it gets moved with timestamp appended to the /Main folder and then it gets processed again and moved to /Archive.

How to control this back and forth movement of the file.

entry.title: from SAP Universal ID to SAP ID. - big step backwards ?
entry.content:
Today - when logging in -  I learned:

"SAP is transitioning authentication from SAP Universal ID to SAP ID. "

and:

"After September 29th, 2025, you will need to use your S-/ or P-User ID credentials for login."

-> that's a big step backwards, no? üòû

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to retrieve the maximum value within a...
entry.content:
@tsuuuu 

Use a Scriptvariable and bind it to a dynamic text and place it on chart Title Area.

The below code can get you the max date. Place it on initialisation or Table refresh.

//Read Table Date Filter

var datefilter=Table_1.getDataSource().getDimensionFilters("Date"); // Adjust your table name

var strFilter = [""];

if (datefilter[0].type === FilterValueType.Single){
var sfv = cast(Type.SingleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
 strFilter = [sfv.value];
}
else{
var mfv = cast(Type.MultipleFilterValue,datefilter[0]);
for (var i=0, len=mfv.values.length; i< len; i++)
{
strFilter.push(mfv.values[i]);
}
var laststrFilter = strFilter.slice(-1);
}

var dateString = laststrFilter[0].split('&[')[1];
ScriptVariable_1 = dateString.slice(0, -1); //Adjust as per your script variable

Output

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil
